Amazon is not the stellar retailer they used to be, but I would not expect them to honor such an obvious mistake even when they were better. The real problem though - in the US, Nikon enforces "universal pricing" (as do most camera manufacturers). If a dealer is caught selling a camera for a price other than what is set by Nikon (either too low or too high), they risk losing their dealership of that brand...
